description:
Agenda:

Member introduction Short presentations Open discussions  

The main goal of this kick-off meeting is to get a sense of the topics/projects that could fuel MLGeek meet-ups (open data, social network analysis, smart phones/sensors/robots hacking, Kaggle competitions, ...).

 

We'll start the meet-up in a room of the computer science department at ULB, so we have an environment with data projector to allow short presentations, and then we can go to 'El café', a chill-out café nearby to continue the discussions.

 

We plan these 'short presentations' (5/10 minutes) so anyone can present with a few slides his/her current/future projects. Prepare some to give a better idea of your interests!

venue.name: Rotule - NO8 Building - Université Libre de Bruxelles

name: Kick-off meet-up

description:
How can we use data science skills to serve our customers better and to convert more prospects.

Speakers:

Dr Wouter Verbeke: Developments in customer churn prediction modeling: social network analysis & optimizing returns of retention campaigns. Dhr Patrick Glenisson

Real live examples of the use of datascience tools en techniques.

Dhr Rik Van Bruggen

Using graph technology to identify potential communities, real live demo.

Frank Vanden Berghen How to solve assignment problem for cross-selling campaigns.

Agenda:

18:30 Update on our first data for good hackathon activities for Doctors without Borders

19:00 Speaker 1

19:25 Speaker 2

19:50 Short break

20:00 Speaker 3

20:25 Speaker 4

21:00 Round Table, Question & Answers

21:30 up we go to the KultuurKaffee
name: Data Science and Marketing
